TopicTitle: Module Manager taking forever to load?

Articles.Content:
Module Manager seems to be stuck on the loading screen...

The mod list is on the right. This weird phenomenon started after I got LLL + LLL Extra. The game had this problem, so I deleted LLL Extra, but keeping LLL, wanting to put windows on my B9 mothership (B9 isn't the cause as it was working pefectly before this happened). The game loaded, but when I entered the SPH, The building was black, the ground and outside were normal, but the buttons + bars on the left and top where completely white. I clicked a part seeing if the game was still functioning properly. Upon clicking, the game crashed, and this has been happening ever since. I also use CKAN to install my mods, so here's the mod list on that too.

Another note is that the game isn't actually frozen here, as the "witty loading hints" keep changing.

Can someone help me please? Thanks in advance.

Edited October 14, 2015 by SmashingKirby148
I'm pretty sure the mods are the right ones.
If you opened the debug log (alt+F2) you could see what it was getting stuck on while it loaded, or even take a look in the KSP.log or output_log.txt

If you opened the debug log (alt+F2) you could see what it was getting stuck on while it loaded, or even take a look in the KSP.log or output_log.txt

Actually, I deleted all the mods, and then open the game. It worked. I then reinstalled ONLY B9, and the Module Manager stuck thing happened again, so I think B9's module Manager is bugged.

IIRC, B9 has last been updated for 0.90, so it is normal it doesn't work properly in 1.0.x.

The mod is not compatible with 1.0.x versions of the game.
Wait, hold on, what does the red text mean?

Installing KSP in some folders used by Windows can prevent it from writing/using some files. That might be your issue.

I have my KSP installs in C:\Games. As it is a custom folder, there is no problem with this issue.

Installing KSP in some folders used by Windows can prevent it from writing/using some files. That might be your issue.I have my KSP installs in C:\Games. As it is a custom folder, there is no problem with this issue.
That's weird! It was fine before!

I don't know much about this issue, you should probably wait for someone who knows more to explain it in detail. He'd have more chance to fix it for you.

Switched install location, same bug. WHY LACK LUSTER LABS WHY. T^T

Why don't you try and doing this: Delete that mod and the module manager. It should go back to normal. If the module manager refuses to be deleted, Uninstall Kerbal Space Program and then re-install it.
Yay! I fixed it! I just redownloaded the game :]
